author: carlhenryglobal
title: ADA Payments for Joomla 3 & 4
description: The Joomla Extension Directory does not offer a Cardano ADA Payment option for popular Shopping Carts.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal team is leveraging COTI's API in Joomla as a payment option for e-commerce platforms.
f6_assessments.q1: The team had the qualified PHP and Joomla experience building similar integrations and they demonstrate a strong understanding of the COTI APIs.
f6_assessments.q2: The team provides a brief project overview describing their plans to build a COTI ADA pay plugin into Joomla for ecommerce devs. The team should consider adding detailed KPIs for CAs to better assess their implementation plans.

f6_assessments.q0: By making gateway for COTI / ADA payment inside Joomla Shopping Cart plugin you have an advantage to be a pioneer in CARDANO payment network usage.
f6_assessments.q1: Building plugin for Joomla 3/4 content management system (CMS) with 20+ years of experiences and a team of dedicated developers would open opportunities for mass COTI adoptions, but first thing to consider is about the security, because regular user need to make sure that ADA network is reliable and secure.
f6_assessments.q2: With given time and much more experiences from the proposer, I'm having a confidence that this proposal will run in given time to produce payment gateway for shopping cart plugin in inside Joomla.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal meets the challenge funds by looking to expand ADA pay into Joomla 3 and 4 e-commerce packages expanding the potential uses of Cardano more broadly.

f6_assessments.q1: Relevant experience and team has been provided. Budget is very reasonable and has been broken down into identifiable items. The timetable they provided to finish this project is achievable. The details they provided on what gets built and how it gets built is very little and can be easily overlooked. Digging a little deeper in the details there wouldn't hurt and in fact will give the reader a sense of your skills and potentially boost confidence in your project. They haven't considered any risks or challenges.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap is one milestone and that is the finish date. Providing more milestones will enable the community to track the progress of your project. You can break up your project into parts and put timestamps on them. The KPIs are the number of installations and the completion of the software. They haven't really explained what success would look like. Yes it could be the number of installations, but how many installations would be success for you. Set a target so that the user can track the performance of your project. The targeted problem is explained in detail and the solution they  provide is a simple plugin for an already established payment solution.

f6_assessments.q0: Proposer clearly informs in which way his idea will improve accessibility of ADA payments to users. Big plus that the team thinks also about Cardano Native Tokens.
f6_assessments.q1: Proposing team consists of professionals in Joomla and ecommerce, with 20 years of experience. They are aware of the market requirements, they know the needs of clients and they know Joomla as well as its developers. Plan is clearly stated and roadmap has reasonable dates included. Budget is well documented. It should work out.
f6_assessments.q2: Number of instalations and add-on downloads should be sufficient to know how successful the proposal is.

f6_assessments.q0: This is an interesting proposal with good potential to reach the goal of the challenge. However, I feel that it lacked some explanations on how they intend to implement that. Their objectives are aligned with the goals of the challenge and the idea to focus on joomla as a way to catapult the solution sounds solid. However, more comments could have been given regarding the ideas they aim to put in practice. How exactly they intend to make the plug-in easy-to-use and scalable was not thoroughly debated. The quality of the solution could have been more deeply discussed as well.  In other words, this proposal seems to have good potential, but the team could have articulated better and, in more details, how they expect to add value to the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: Enough evidence was given to support the skills and experience the team have in order to implement this proposal. The budget on the other hand is not very explored, there are few items identified and the estimated costs seem to be lower than needed. The roadmap of the project is a bit poor and not much information is given about it. There is no discussion regarding what is being done in each phase of the workflow. Additionally, the plan lacks the consideration of challenges and potential risks to a successful implementation. Finally, if additional funding is necessary, which is likely given the original budget, the proposal does not seem to be prepared to overcome this situation.
f6_assessments.q2: The auditability of this proposal is not good. It will probably not be easy to evaluate if the project is running as expected. The roadmap is not satisfactory developed and is too vague. The deadlines presented are not precise and there are no KPIs specified to assess the progress of the team. Metrics on the number of users expected to be reached, success of transactions and future scalability without loss of quality of the product could also have been discussed.

f6_assessments.q0:
While not addressing the gross impact of industry leaders like Shopify and WooCommerce this proposal does highlight an important area of nearterm Cardano and AdaPay adoption in regions like Africa and LatAm:  the lack of support the major platforms provide to these regions.  Open source ecommerce platforms currently have the robust development and integration support-communities that are vital to adoption, and Joomla, the target of this Fund7 proposal, is a well-known open source ecommerce platform for these regions. 
 Deploying Adapay via Joomla may have as much impact -in these underserved regions- as more well known platforms like Shopify, due to these open source communities.  This proposal's reasonable budget makes it a good fit for COTI's challenge brief, as it could realistically be funded alongside other proposals as a constellation of AdaPay options.  It is worth noting that this proposal team suggests the ability to leverage any developed assets under this proposal into future PoS possibilities for in-person retail, a possible scaling benefit for AdaPay adoption going forward.
f6_assessments.q1: This team appears to have rolled out ecommerce solutions in the past, and the team's profile indicates extensive familiarity with Joomla specifically, and the PHP and JavaScript necessary to create the plugins.  Additionally they indicate they already have assets ready to wrap with front and backend APIs.  Despite only expecting 11 weeks to rollout the proposed plugins -a rate of 1 plugin per week- the wrapping process should accelerate over that time.  Team management will be essential to delivery on this schedule, and their manager's resume is a strength of the team.  I think voters would appreciate a more comprehensive roadmap in the proposal (steps to execute, less broad descripton of actionable events)  to accommodate the tight schedule, but I do not find its absence to be indicative of a lack of detail on this proposal's feasability.
f6_assessments.q2: Delivery of the plugins will be easy to verify on completion, and the proposers have helpfully included a link to the Joomla extensions directory to allow tracking of this progress.  There was no indication of specifically auditable events outside of completion, however rolling out 11 individual plugins provides natural audit points.  Again, a more comprehensive roadmap would clarify milestones over the approx. 3-month timeline.  Of particular use would be knowing the first AdaPay API integration, and the first client API integration, as well as if the various carts would be approached in any particular order or priority.  They acknowledge, and I agree, that tracking the installations of these Joomla extensions will be a valuable metric to monitor over the course of their development, and will be an easy metric for the at-large Cardano community to appreciate.
